title: Baseline Monitoring for Cisplatin Treatment
chief_complaint: I was sent here for a hearing test before I start my chemotherapy treatment. My hearing seems good right now.

problem_summary.associated_symptoms: None reported (denies tinnitus, dizziness, otalgia, or aural fullness).
problem_summary.goals_motivation: Establish baseline hearing thresholds prior to ototoxic chemotherapy (cisplatin) and monitor for changes.

history.present_illness: Patient diagnosed with ovarian cancer and scheduled for treatment with cisplatin. Unsure of the number of treatment cycles.
history.otologic_history: Reports good hearing bilaterally. Denies tinnitus, dizziness, otalgia, or fullness.
history.noise_exposure_history: Works in a cheese production factory around louder noises.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.key_findings: Normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally from 250 to 8000 Hz. High-frequency audiometry (9–16 kHz) was also performed to establish a baseline for ototoxicity monitoring.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.key_findings: Speech Recognition Thresholds (SRT) are in agreement with pure-tone averages. Word Recognition Scores (WRS) are excellent bilaterally.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.key_findings: Normal middle ear function bilaterally (Type A).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.key_findings: Ipsilateral and contralateral reflexes present at normal levels (500-4000 Hz). Reflex decay was negative.

overall_audiologic_summary: The patient demonstrates normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally across the standard frequency range (250–8000 Hz) with excellent speech discrimination. Extended high-frequency testing (9000–16000 Hz) was successfully recorded to serve as a sensitive baseline for ototoxicity. Middle ear function is normal.
counseling_points: Cisplatin is a medication that can sometimes damage the inner ear, potentially causing hearing loss or tinnitus (ringing in the ears).
It is critical to have your hearing checked before each dose (or as recommended) to catch any changes early.
Noise exposure combined with this medication can increase the risk of hearing damage.
Since you work in a cheese production factory with loud noise, you must be diligent about wearing hearing protection at work.
notes_for_actor: Portray a 25-year-old woman who is understandably preoccupied with her cancer diagnosis but currently feels her hearing is fine.
You work in a factory but may not have been strict about earplugs in the past; be receptive to the advice about noise protection.
You are cooperative and willing to return for follow-up testing.
